results.title: Infection control in the workplace
results.brief_description: This video and trainers guide is a simple to understand, effective package to help prevent blood borne diseases being transferred in any workplace situation involving blood.
results.description: This video and trainers guide is a simple to understand, effective package to help prevent blood borne diseases being transferred in any workplace situation involving blood.

results.title: Infant development in the kibbutz (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines infant behaviour under the kibbutz system of shared parental and group care. Shows activities of the “baby house” where babies ranging from newborn to 21 months old are cared for while their parents are at work.
results.description: Examines infant behaviour under the kibbutz system of shared parental and group care. Shows activities of the “baby house” where babies ranging from newborn to 21 months old are cared for while their parents are at work.

results.title: Infant dance (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Wolverhampton Education Committee and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: A class of 6-7 year olds is observed performing spontaneous dance movements, movements inspired by suggestions from the teacher, and by short rhythms played on percussion instruments. Individual children are studied in closer detail.

results.title: Infant cognition (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality and Learning”.
An exploration of the development of the bond between mother and her baby. Using special filming technique it analyses sequences of what is known as per-speech, a recently discovered phenomenon where babies, even of a few days old, take part in adult-type conversations with their mothers.

results.title: Infancy (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bay State Film Productions, Harper & Row, Jerome Kagan, Howard Gardner and Glen Howard
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Examines behaviour and cognitive patterns characteristic of the first 18 months of life, including object permanence, stranger and separation anxiety, reaction to discrepancy and maturing co-ordinations. Discusses individual differences in infant temperament.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bay State Film Productions, Harper & Row, Jerome Kagan, Howard Gardner and Glen Howard

results.title: Inertial mass
results.creator_credit: Educational Services Incorporated, Stephen White and Norton Bloom
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Edward M. Purcell demonstrates that acceleration is inversely proportional to mass with force constant and that different objects may have the same inertial mass. Compares inertial and gravitational mass and shows how they are proportional. A continuation of the film “Inertia”.

results.title: Inertia
results.creator_credit: Educational Services and Physical Sciences Study Committee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Edward M. Purcell demonstrates Galileo’s principle of inertia in experiments with a body moving horizontally with minimal friction and using low friction dry-ice pucks and multiple flash photography showing acceleration is proportional to force when mass is constant. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Inert(?) gas compounds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
The first synthesis of krypton difluoride is traced from its inspiration to the first tentative success. Krypton difluoride is prepared by photolysis of fluorine in solid krypton at the temperature of liquid hydrogen and identified by its infrared spectrum.
results.description:

results.title: Industries of the future
results.creator_credit: CBS News, Isaac Kleinerman and David Tapper
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Considers the course of industry, technology and invention during the coming century. Examines the kind of innovations that will shape the civilisation of the future. Studies the opportunities and changes that will arise from the development of an industrially and scientifically oriented society. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.
